title: About the formula in the MIVVAI version
body: Hello, I have read your paper: A. V. Dalca, G. Balakrishnan, J. Guttag, and M. R. Sabuncu, “Unsupervised Learning for Fast Probabilistic Diffeomorphic Registration,” in Medical Image Computing and Computer Assisted Intervention – MICCAI 2018, vol. 11070, Cham: Springer International Publishing, 2018, pp. 729–738. doi: [10.1007/978-3-030-00928-1_82](https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-030-00928-1_82). I am confused about the semicolon(;) in the formula(4). In this former, for example, y is the parameters of p(x|z;y). But in fact, y is variable, just like x. Given x and y, we will find p(x|z,y). We do not need to change y. see https://www.toolsou.com/en/article/220276803 Only in this way, the second line in (4) can be derived to the third line in (4) using p(z|x,y)=p(x,y,z)/p(x,y). Besides, formula (5) has also verified my assumption. the z|x;y in the left should be changed to z|x,y as it is in the right. So I assume that some of the semicolons( ; ) should be changed to comma( , ). Isn't it?
